original_title: Siyapatha Finance unveils newest branch in the historic town of Mahiyanganaya
original_body_lines: Homegrown finance company Siyapatha Finance PLC recently expanded its holistic services to the ancient agricultural hub of Mahiyanganaya, progressing onto the successful opening of its 56th branch.

Resonating with the company’s vision to deliver optimum value to its stakeholders, the latest branch offers a wide product portfolio ranging from leasing, fixed deposits, savings, gold financing, business loans, personal loans, fast draft, and factoring to the Smart Pay facility to provide an exceptional customer experience in the region.

The Mahiyanganaya branch was declared open by Siyapatha Finance PLC Managing Director Ananda Seneviratne, in the presence of Siyapatha Finance PLC Chief Operating Officer Rajeev De Silva, senior management, and staff as well as Mahiyanganaya Divisional Secretary   Vimansa Senevirathna, Inspector of Police P.S.K. De silva, Grama Niladhari R.N.S. Ranawaka, Trade Association President Sarath Mahinda Kumara, officials from government and private banks and insurance companies, and well-wishers.

Adorned by the subtle fusion of lush greenery, natural beauty, and religious and historical importance, Mahiyanganaya is seated at the heart of the Badulla District. Derived from the ancient Pali language, the name means “flat land”, signifying the notable flatness of the land through the road from Kandy to Padiyathalawa across Hunnasgiriya and the 18 hairpin bends, famously known as the “Daha Ata Wanguwa”.

Situated in close proximity to the Mahaweli River, the longest river in Sri Lanka, the community’s way of life and livelihood are deeply rooted in its traditional agricultural practices, where a majority 52.30% of the active workforce engage in paddy cultivation. Over the decades, the Mahaweli Development Programme has allowed locals to make greater strides in the agriculture industry by seizing opportunities that were otherwise unreachable.
